title: No, ANI Did Not Use Old Pictures From New York On International Yoga Day
subtitle: A tweet by Asian News International (ANI) on Yoga being performed outside the United Nations office in New York drew curious responses from many on Wednesday. The news agency tweeted the pictures as...
author: www.boomlive.in
vclaim: A tweet by Asian News International (ANI) on Yoga being performed outside the United Nations office in New York drew curious responses from many on Wednesday. The news agency tweeted the pictures as part of its coverage of International Yoga Day being observed on June 21st.However ANI's tweet at 10.04 am Indian Standard Time (IST) raised questions about the authenticity of the images because of the time difference with New York. Many including Congress Spokesperson Manish Tewari questioned the pictures. Some speculated if Yoga was being done under artificial lights, others said the pictures were fake.BOOM also asked ANI if the pictures were file (old) pictures.The news agency in response tweeted that it had received the pictures at 4 am IST on Wednesday.BOOM cross checked with the United Nations' website and found out that a Yoga session was organised on June 20th at 6 pm to 7.30 pm local time. (6.30 pm Eastern Time would be 4 am India time) The UN also has Yoga related events scheduled for June 21st.Multiple tweets from Syed Akbaruddin, India's ambassador to the UN confirmed the same.The wires service agency has gone all out in covering International Yoga Day in contrast with Press Trust of India which has far lesser tweets about the occasion. We counted over 40 tweets from ANI at the time of writing this story. 1.
